Eduardo VÃ¡zquez, coordinador del ComitÃ© Unitario de Solidaridad Ecuador con Palestina que convocÃ³ a la movilizaciÃ³n, afirmÃ³ que el objetivo es exigir el fin de los ataques en la Franja de Gaza asÃ­ como el reconocimiento del pueblo palestino a su autodeterminaciÃ³n.
Representantes de diversos colectivos sociales y polÃ­ticos se sumaron a la marcha contra la escalada de violencia.
Apelamos a la movilizaciÃ³n en AmÃ©rica Latina y el mundo para detener ya la masacre en Gaza, seÃ±alÃ³ VÃ¡zquez, quien subrayÃ³ que intereses imperiales estÃ¡n detrÃ¡s de los ataques.
Esa y otras acciones de solidaridad desde Ecuador con el pueblo palestino se desarrollan en medio de la ofensiva desatada por Tel Aviv en respuesta a un ataque coordinado por el movimiento palestino Hamas (el 7 de octubre pasado).
En represalia, Israel lanzÃ³ una declaraciÃ³n de guerra contra Hamas y emprendiÃ³ una serie de bombardeos en la Franja de Gaza que han dejado hasta el momento mÃ¡s de 40 mil vÃ­ctimas fatales, de los cuales casi el 70 por ciento son mujeres y niÃ±os, y mÃ¡s de 92 mil 400 heridos.

O humorista e cantor Whindersson Nunes estÃ¡ internado em uma clÃ­nica psiquiÃ¡trica desde a semana passada. A informaÃ§Ã£o foi confirmada por sua assessoria, na noite desta quinta-feira (20).
Ele se internou "por decisÃ£o prÃ³pria e com o devido acompanhamento mÃ©dico, em uma clÃ­nica no interior de SÃ£o Paulo", segundo o comunicado enviado pela assessoria.

author: Marielle Mohs
title: Long-awaited fresh snowfall leads to busy Twin Cities ski slopes on New Year's Eve - CBS Minnesota
text:
BURNSVILLE, Minn. â€” Sunday's snow is a most welcomed sight for the Twin Cities' outdoor recreation businesses.
December's historic warmth forced at least a dozen ski hills across the state and western Wisconsin to close earlier this week.
But Sunday's fresh powder meant plenty of fun, especially for folks at Buck Hill in Burnsville.
RELATED: Minnesota's weird winter weather taking toll on seasonal businesses
Mae Turman and her sister Ada say the snow gave the slopes more traction.
"There's a little bit of ice but with the fresh powder, it makes it a little bit better," Mae Turman said.
"It's nice to get some carving out there and it feels like you can really go down the hill nicely," Ada Turman said.
Buck Hill had some setbacks in December. It was so warm and rainy on Christmas eve and day that they closed the slopes.
WCCO "This season, because it hasn't snow very much, yes, it's a little disappointing," Mae Turman said.
But look how much it can change in just a week.
Sunday was the first day skiing for the Patel family this season. Grandpa Ashok says his twin granddaughters â€” Aayushi and Ishani â€” have been waiting a long time for real snow.
"They got their rental skis here in October, they were patiently waiting til November, and now we are in January almost," Ashok Patel said.
But the wait was worth it.
RELATED: Swimming in ice rinks and kayaking in December: A memorable, unseasonable Christmas
"I think it was really nice. It was kind of hard because I tripped a few times, but it was fun," Aayushi said.
"I don't think there's any better way to celebrate," Ishani said,
These skiers and snowboarders are hopeful this last-minute snow is a sign of what's to come next month.
"It's just a great way to ring in the new year," Ada Turman said.
Buck Hill is going to be having its own New Year's Eve celebration Sunday night with food, music and champagne. And the runs are going to be open until 11:30 p.m. so you can truly ski and snowboard until the final minutes of 2023.
Buck Hill plans to capitalize on the fresh snow and make more of it overnight, so New Year's Day will be another great ski day.
RELATED: Record high temperature recorded in Minnesota on Christmas Day
